question: 計画
sourceMnemonic: When you do a <kanji>drawing</kanji> of a <kanji>measurement</kanji> you want to do on the chalkboard, you're drawing up a <vocabulary>plan</vocabulary> for doing something. All things require some kind of measurement, so drawing that measurement up is your plan.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well. The reading for <ja>画</ja> is the secondary reading though (<ja>かく</ja>), so take note of that.
